intro: Pagothyra maculata, commonly known as the spotted sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Indo-Pacific. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in shallow marine environments, such as tidal zones and sandy shores. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with distinctive spots or markings. Its leaves are usually broad and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in saline conditions. Pagothyra maculata plays a role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
